item.title: 5 Things To Watch As GOP Health Bill Moves To The Senate
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526922980/gop-health-bill-moves-to-the-senate-5-things-to-watch

item.title: American Hospital Association Head Outlines Opposition To GOP Health Bill
item.description: May 4, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Rick Pollack, president and CEO of the American Hospital Association, about how the Republican health care plan would affect hospitals and why he opposes it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Rick Pollack, president and CEO of the American Hospital Association, about how the Republican health care plan would affect hospitals and why he opposes it. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/04/526931893/american-hospital-association-head-outlines-opposition-to-gop-health-bill

item.title: Research Explores How Youth Access To Guns Is Linked To Mental Health Issues
item.description: May 4, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Eric Sigel, a professor of pediatrics at the University of Colorado School of Medicine and adolescent medicine specialist at Children's Hospital Colorado. He led new research that looks into how access to guns among adolescents is an indicator of more mental health issues and violent behavior.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks with Eric Sigel, a professor of pediatrics at the University of Colorado School of Medicine and adolescent medicine specialist at Children's Hospital Colorado. He led new research that looks into how access to guns among adolescents is an indicator of more mental health issues and violent behavior. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/04/526931907/research-explores-how-youth-access-to-guns-is-linked-to-mental-health-issues

item.title: House Passes Revised Version Of Republican Health Care Bill
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Over a month after abruptly pulling their plan to repeal and replace Obamacare from the floor, House Republicans voted Wednesday on a revised version of that bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Over a month after abruptly pulling their plan to repeal and replace Obamacare from the floor, House Republicans voted Wednesday on a revised version of that bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/04/526931886/house-passes-revised-version-of-republican-health-care-bill

item.title: Winners And Losers Under The House GOP Health Bill
item.description: May 4, 2017 - The version of the American Health Care Act passed by the House eliminates taxes on corporations and wealthy people and shrinks Medicaid coverage. A chart breaks down who would be affected and how.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - The version of the American Health Care Act passed by the House eliminates taxes on corporations and wealthy people and shrinks Medicaid coverage. A chart breaks down who would be affected and how. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526925764/winners-and-losers-under-the-house-gop-health-bill

item.title: Here Is What's In The House-Approved Health Care Bill
item.description: May 4, 2017 - The House GOP's bill to replace the Affordable Care Act would all but eliminate the requirement that people buy health insurance and shrink Medicaid coverage. It also cuts taxes for the wealthy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - The House GOP's bill to replace the Affordable Care Act would all but eliminate the requirement that people buy health insurance and shrink Medicaid coverage. It also cuts taxes for the wealthy. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526887531/heres-whats-in-the-house-approved-health-care-bill

item.title: Helping Wheelchair Users Navigate Mexico City's Hectic Streets And Sidewalks
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Mexico City can be unfriendly terrain for those in a wheelchair. But a new program aims to help them better navigate the city's bad traffic, broken pavement and oblivious pedestrians.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Mexico City can be unfriendly terrain for those in a wheelchair. But a new program aims to help them better navigate the city's bad traffic, broken pavement and oblivious pedestrians. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/05/04/525884861/helping-wheelchair-users-navigate-mexico-citys-hectic-streets-and-sidewalks

item.title: Trump 'Confident' About GOP Health Care Bill's Prospects In The Senate
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Passage in the House is the first step in fulfilling the GOP's longtime pledge to dismantle Obamacare. The president praised House Speaker Ryan as a "genius" for engineering the legislative victory.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Passage in the House is the first step in fulfilling the GOP's longtime pledge to dismantle Obamacare. The president praised House Speaker Ryan as a "genius" for engineering the legislative victory. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/04/526866090/trump-confident-about-gop-health-care-bills-prospects-in-the-senate

item.title: To Bring Down Stubbornly High Blood Pressure, It Helps To Have A Team
item.description: May 4, 2017 - A quick prescription and annual lecture from a doctor often aren't enough to help people control hypertension. So some clinics now mobilize teams of health pros to motivate and support patients.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - A quick prescription and annual lecture from a doctor often aren't enough to help people control hypertension. So some clinics now mobilize teams of health pros to motivate and support patients. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526475132/to-bring-down-stubbornly-high-blood-pressure-it-helps-to-have-a-team

item.title: GOP Passes Its Health Care Bill At Long Last, But Still A Long Way To Go
item.description: May 4, 2017 - The House voted Thursday to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. But this bill will likely never become law, at least not in its current form, and the road ahead is bumpy and full of potholes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - The House voted Thursday to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. But this bill will likely never become law, at least not in its current form, and the road ahead is bumpy and full of potholes. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/04/526854352/gop-expected-to-pass-its-health-care-bill-at-long-last-but-still-a-long-way-to-g

item.title: Spit Test May Reveal The Severity Of A Child's Concussion
item.description: May 4, 2017 - By measuring fragments of genetic material in saliva, scientists were able to accurately predict whether a young person's concussion symptoms would last days or weeks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - By measuring fragments of genetic material in saliva, scientists were able to accurately predict whether a young person's concussion symptoms would last days or weeks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526782407/spit-test-may-reveal-the-severity-of-a-child-s-concussion

item.title: The Daredevils Without Landlines â€” And Why Health Experts Are Tracking Them
item.description: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile phones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile phones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2015/12/03/458225197/the-daredevils-without-landlines-and-why-health-experts-are-tracking-them

item.title: House Republican Leaders Plan Vote On Revised Health Care Bill
item.description: May 3, 2017 - House Republican leaders are planning a vote on the American Health Care Act on Thursday. The bill has been revised to provide options for states to opt out of some key Obamacare requirements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - House Republican leaders are planning a vote on the American Health Care Act on Thursday. The bill has been revised to provide options for states to opt out of some key Obamacare requirements. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526810299/house-republican-leaders-plan-vote-on-revised-health-care-bill

item.title: House To Vote On GOP Health Care Bill Thursday With Leadership Sure Of Support
item.description: May 3, 2017 - After a series of changes, including one to create federal high-risk pools, the Republicans' health care plan is headed back to the House floor for a vote. The majority leader says it will pass.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - After a series of changes, including one to create federal high-risk pools, the Republicans' health care plan is headed back to the House floor for a vote. The majority leader says it will pass. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526771424/is-the-gop-health-bill-morphing-into-yet-another-big-federal-program

item.title: Trump Lobbies House Republicans To Vote For Health Care Bill
item.description: May 3, 2017 - President Trump personally lobbied House Republicans on Wednesday to vote for the revised GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - President Trump personally lobbied House Republicans on Wednesday to vote for the revised GOP plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526779483/trump-lobbies-house-republicans-to-vote-for-health-care-bill
